docs.lead_paragraph: Delving into the sensitive subject of women's rights in the workplace, the U.S. Supreme Court will consider on Wednesday whether employers must provide accommodations for pregnant workers who may have a hard time doing their usual job duties.

headline.main: U.S. Top Court to Weigh UPS Pregnancy Discrimination Claim
headline.print_headline: U.S. Top Court to Weigh UPS Pregnancy Discrimination Claim

docs.snippet: Delving into the sensitive subject of women's rights in the workplace, the U.S. Supreme Court will consider on Wednesday whether employers must provide accommodations for pregnant workers who may have a hard time doing their usual job duties.

docs.lead_paragraph: Strict abortion laws in Senegal are forcing women to seek clandestine abortions and as a last resort kill their own infants, according to a new report by human rights groups.

headline.main: In Senegal, Women Kill Own Babies Due to Strict Abortion Laws
headline.print_headline: In Senegal, Women Kill Own Babies Due to Strict Abortion Laws

docs.snippet: Strict abortion laws in Senegal are forcing women to seek clandestine abortions and as a last resort kill their own infants, according to a new report by human rights groups.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Bravo channel is delivering an early holiday gift to viewers that should be opened immediately.

headline.print_headline: 'Girlfriends' Guide to Divorce' Is a Bravo First

docs.snippet: The Bravo channel is delivering an early holiday gift to viewers that should be opened immediately.

docs.lead_paragraph: Peggy Young only has to look at her younger daughter to be reminded how long she has fought United Parcel Service over its treatment of pregnant employees, and why.

headline.main: Ex-UPS Driver's Pregnancy Bias Claim at High Court
headline.print_headline: Ex-UPS Driver's Pregnancy Bias Claim at High Court

docs.snippet: Peggy Young only has to look at her younger daughter to be reminded how long she has fought United Parcel Service over its treatment of pregnant employees, and why.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pregnant workers should not be treated worse than employees who are injured on the job.
docs.abstract: Editorial holds Supreme Court has opportunity to cast blow against discriminatory treatment of pregnant woman as it hears case of former United Parcel Service worker Peggy Young against UPS; notes UPS claims it has the right to deny pregnant workers the flexibility it shows to workers with other conditions that limit their ability to perform; urges court to use plain reading of Pregnancy Discrimination Act to rule that pregnant workers can be treated no worse than other employees injured on the job.
docs.snippet: Pregnant workers should not be treated worse than employees who are injured on the job.

docs.lead_paragraph: The court is to consider the case of a former United Parcel Service employee who sued after being placed on unpaid leave when she became pregnant.

headline.main: Case Seeking Job Protections for Pregnant Women Heads to Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Case Seeking Job Protections for Pregnant Women Heads to Supreme Court

docs.abstract: Supreme Court will hear case of Peggy Young, former United Parcel Service driver who was placed on unpaid leave after becoming pregnant; court's decision has potential to affect lives of millions of women, who make up 47 percent of labor force and often work during and late into their pregnancies.
docs.snippet: The court is to consider the case of a former United Parcel Service employee who sued after being placed on unpaid leave when she became pregnant.
